intro: Stenogyne rugosa var. punaensis, commonly known as the Puna mountain heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and cloud forests. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
